channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: About 30,000 WA properties are without power on Wednesday morning after the season’s first fierce storm packing winds of up to 128km/h took down power lines, razed fences and blew trampolines through Perth’s streets.
item.title: First powerful storm of the season leaves thousands without power and Perth littered in debris

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe downloads top 5 million as Scott Morrison flags road to economic recovery, global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.5 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: One of five councillors who voted to ban the Storm from Albury City Council facilities has revealed the reasoning behind his decision.
item.title: Storm ban due to players flouting distancing, says Albury councillor

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: national death toll nears 100 including six in the state

item.description: New York remains the epicentre of the novel coronavirus, but US Open officials haven't abandoned hope of staging the grand slam event. However, many top players think the 2020 season is all but over.
item.title: See you in Melbourne? Tennis world confronts grim outlook

item.description: The body representing global airlines is in favour of passengers wearing masks onboard but has but came out against leaving middle seats empty on aircraft.
item.title: Global airlines body IATA backs face masks for safe flying

item.description: Philadelphia's Australian All-Star was forced from the court in February with a back injury three weeks before the league was shut down indefinitely.
item.title: Sixers optimistic Simmons will be ready when NBA resumes

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The health risks of vaping are contested, but one councillor says being "swamped" by e-cigarette smoke is reason enough to ban them.
item.title: 'Not convinced': CBD e-cigarette ban to be put to public

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: The first case of coronavirus connected with Cedar Meats was identified more than a month ago. But authorities did not consider the Brooklyn abattoir an exposure site.
item.title: First COVID-19 case at Cedar Meats found more than a month ago, but site remained open

item.description: The pandemic may finally be past its peak but markets are no longer expecting a rapid economic recovery as the realisation sinks in that the exit from COVID-19 might be messy.
item.title: Damaged and scarred: Psychological effect of pandemic set to hold back economic recovery

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Millions of ratepayer dollars could have been wasted in contract extensions approved by unauthorised council officers in WA, a damning report by the Auditor General has revealed.
item.title: Millions in WA council contracts under the spotlight following damning report

item.dc:creator: Alice Clarke
item.description: Tips and tech to help you manage the extra home grubbiness now you're not spreading your hair and dead skin out and about.
item.title: Your germs are isolated at home with you too

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set to edge lower at open

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: “What the f---?,” were the first words out of Bradley Edwards’ mouth as a Macro detective told him why he was under arrest just minutes after TRG officers had stormed his house and pinned him to the floor.
item.title: 'Why me?': Accused Claremont serial killer's dramatic arrest interview played at trial

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Perth's waited a long time for property prices to rally, and by late March was braced for further blows. How low could we go? But seems the news ain't all bad.
item.title: Perth property post-COVID: How recent pain could prove our gain

item.description: Airbnb says it is laying off a quarter of its workforce as it confronts a steep decline in global travel due to the new coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'Harrowing crisis': Airbnb laying off 25 per cent of employees due to travel decline

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Dr Rick Bright says he tried to raise the alarm about COVID-19 in January but encountered resistance from senior officials who instead downplayed its threat.
item.title: Whistleblower complaint blasts Trump administration's COVID-19 response

item.description: Spain's tennis federation released a statement to clarify that players were not allowed to return to courts until May 11 after an Instagram post from Djokovic.
item.title: Spanish club apologises for Djokovic lockdown confusion

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The Australian biotechnology giant will use plasma from recovered coronavirus patients to start developing a possible treatment for those who become seriously ill from COVID-19.
item.title: CSL relying on recovered COVID-19 patients for new treatment project

item.description: Administration officials are telling task force members and their staff to expect the group to wind down within weeks, even as infections continue.
item.title: White House looking at winding down coronavirus task force: Pence

item.description: French media reports suggest the claycourt major is set to be delayed a further week allowing for more space after the US Open in September.
item.title: French Open in talks over rescheduling as game finalises COVID support

item.description: Epidemiologist Neil Ferguson had reportedly been visited by a 38-year old woman on two occasions.
item.title: Lockdown professor steps down after breaking rules to meet married lover

item.description: Stocks pulled back sharply late in the session after Federal Reserve Vice Chair Richard Clarida made downbeat comments about the depth of the economic contraction.
item.title: Wall Street finishes higher but Fed official's sobering outlook limits gains

item.description: New infections per day in the US exceed 20,000 and deaths are well over 1000, according to figures from Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Infection rate outside of New York rising as states open up

item.description: Pharma giant administers experimental vaccines to New Yorkers, part of a bid to shave years off of the typical time it takes to develop a new inoculation.
item.title: Pfizer starts US human trials of COVID-19 vaccine

item.description: Some of the biggest US stock traders just got the green light to open their own exchange.
item.title: Wall Street heavyweights get green light to start their own stock exchange

item.dc:creator: Sophia Phan
item.description: Three luxury items are flying into the carts of self-isolating Australians – proving that for some, layering fancy face oils is the ultimate act of self-care.
item.title: The unexpected beauty products selling out in lockdown

item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison said the monarch called on Tuesday night to check on Australians amid the coronavirus pandemic and lockdowns.
item.title: The Queen calls Scott Morrison to wish Australians well amid pandemic

item.description: Only the US, with a population nearly five times greater, has suffered more confirmed fatalities from the virus than Britain, according to the data so far.
item.title: UK overtakes Italy with Europe's highest official coronavirus death toll

item.description: The children were admitted to intensive care and required cardiac or respiratory support, including five who required mechanical ventilation. None have died.
item.title: Fifteen children in New York City develop serious inflammatory syndrome possibly linked to COVID-19

item.description: "George Conway, take a look at him, just take a look at that guy, the man's a stone-cold loser," Trump said in response to a new video released by the Lincoln Project.
item.title: Donald Trump hits out at 'stone-cold loser' George Conway over coronavirus ad

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Logging native forests increases the severity and risk of bushfires and likely had a significant effect on Australia's summer fires, new research shows.
item.title: Logging likely had significant effect on summer fires: scientists

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Have you found time during the pandemic lockdown to write your novel, bake Instagram-worthy sourdough bread, train for a marathon and learn to crochet?
item.title: Free time for new hobbies? Tell 'em they're dreamin'

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The competition’s strict stay-at-home protocols will be temporarily relaxed on Sunday so NRL stars can see their mothers - but it comes with stipulations.
item.title: Mum's the word: NRL players given exemption for Mother's Day visits

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: New research on the system challenges wider understanding of past climates and how the river has emptied into the sea over millennia.
item.title: Like a fiord: Ancient Murray River lake reveals our changing climate

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Seven points about recession and why Scott Morrison’s treatment of the unemployed is much more benevolent.
item.title: Hard lessons on how recessions work and why we hate them so much

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Fox Sports has begun preparing for the possibility of a rugby league future without Channel Nine.
item.title: Fox Sports eyes Origin, grand final as Nine threatens to walk away from NRL

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: The switch away from cash is set to accelerate the trend towards alternative payment methods including online purchases.
item.title: Strapped for cash: coronavirus is changing the way we pay

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, May 6

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The telco says it has protected about 500 customers in the last month from COVID-19-themed malware which attempted to steal their money.
item.title: 'Weakened defences': COVID-19 a boon for malware merchants, warns Telstra boss

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Victoria’s building industry is calling on the state government to allow it to trial an easing of COVID-19 restrictions saying construction had taken a “productivity hit” during the pandemic.
item.title: Push for building industry to trial easing of COVID-19 restrictions

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The chief executive of hardware giant Bunnings, Michael Schneider, has called for greater scrutiny of short-term changes to IR legislation.
item.title: 'A slippery slope': Bunnings boss calls for industrial relations scrutiny

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Buying local has taken on a new meaning as locked-down consumers put their neighbourhood suburban shopping strip ahead of large car-focused retail centres.
item.title: Shoppers, investors put coronavirus twist on buy local mantra

item.dc:creator: Clover Moore
item.description: The money going to the unpopular Powerhouse relocation would be better spent supporting Carriageworks and other vital arts organisations.
item.title: Scrap the Powerhouse plan and use the $1.5 billion to save Carriageworks

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: National Storage has joined the capital-raising conga line to shore up its balance sheet, adding to the injection of cash into the listed trusts in the past fortnight.
item.title: Investors pump more than $2b into listed property market

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Melbourne has withstood the pandemic by feeding itself on largely locally grown foods from here and interstate. But for how long if urban sprawl continues?
item.title: Planners say pandemic shows farmland on city fringes is crucial

item.description: The COVID-19 crisis has seen politicians paying attention to scientists in the search for solutions. Climate change merits a similar approach.
item.title: Consensus helps beat virus and can also avert global warming

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Coverage for things like telehealth psychology is only up until June, but it could be here to stay.
item.title: Health insurers look to extend telehealth coverage after coronavirus

item.description: A public and transparent inquiry is necessary to prevent a similar tragedy happening in other aged care homes.
item.title: Ruby Princess-style inquiry needed into Newmarch House
